page.title: 07Gaer Fawr woods
page.content: On May30 1985 we visited Gaer Fawr Wood.This wood,lying on the sides of an ancient hill fort is perhaps the outstanding feature within our block.It is now owned by The Woodland Trust,a nationwide organisation dedicated to the preservation of the natural aforestation of our countryside.It has just been purchased for Â£38,000.The aim of the trust is to promote good growth of trees,and to leave the area as natural as possible.The initial problem was to educate some of the local people to respect the natural beauty of a deciduous wood.Any necessary alterations will take place slowly, thus not altering the character of the wood. We found the commonest tree is the Sycamore,and some of these will have to be felled to allow trees such as
